title: Sinai Covenant Structure
objective: Recognize covenant treaty form in Exodus 19-20

segments.audio_script: This is lesson eleven. You are studying Sinai covenant structure. Lesson ten examined Passover as substitutionary sacrifice.
God meets Israel at Mount Sinai. The covenant is formalized in ratification ceremony. Thunder and fire accompany the event. The context emphasizes divine transcendence and holiness.

The Sinai covenant includes explicit stipulations. The Ten Commandments represent covenant law. This differs from Abrahamic covenant which contains only promises. Sinai adds obligation and reciprocity.

Key themes: Sinai covenant follows ancient treaty pattern. It includes preamble, historical prologue, stipulations, and sanctions. The Decalogue represents fundamental law. Covenant membership requires obedience.
What is the central law given at Sinai?
This completes lesson eleven. You studied Sinai covenant structure. Next lesson examines law and covenant relationship.

vocabulary.definition: God's covenant with Israel at Mount Sinai including law and stipulations governing covenant membership
The Ten Commandments representing the fundamental law of the Sinai covenant

study_notes: The Sinai covenant differs fundamentally from the Abrahamic covenant. Understanding this distinction is crucial for biblical theology. Abrahamic covenant is unconditional promise; Sinai covenant is conditional law.
